intro: Ocotea blanchetii, commonly known as the Guayacán blanco, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and bark. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a distinctive scent when crushed. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark, round berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
